2022-01-01.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-01-01.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-01-01.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2022-01-01.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-01-01.name: Lakeside Park Holiday Lights
2022-01-01.summary: This free light show on Lake Winnebago includes animated scenes and trees that dance to 20 minutes of music played on 87.9 FM (you can listen on your car radio).

2022-01-01.name: ZooLights
2022-01-01.summary: The annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is operating at limited capacity again this year and charging $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays and Tuesdays. Reserve in advance.

2022-01-01.name: Cool Fool Kite & Ice Festival
2022-01-01.summary: In addition to kite-flying, there will be ice carving, trebuchet tossing and  free hot chocolate, coffee and snacks in the lakefront Veterans Park.

2022-01-01.name: New Year's Day Parade
2022-01-01.summary: Welcome the new year with a 1 p.m. parade. Everyone is welcome to march.

2022-01-01.name: First Day Hikes in Iowa
2022-01-01.summary: More than 50 Iowa state parks will participate in a hiking challenge, and 23 state parks are offering guided hikes, many with hot drinks and snacks. Admission is always free.

2022-01-02.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-01-02.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-01-02.name: ZooLights
2022-01-02.summary: The annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is operating at limited capacity again this year and charging $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays and Tuesdays. Reserve in advance.

2022-01-03.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-01-03.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-01-07.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-07.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-07.name: SISU Ski Fest
2022-01-07.summary: This Finnish fest includes a ski expo, free kids' ski, 5K Fun Ski, 15km and 30km ski races, a free after-party at the Historic Ironwood Theatre and a free fat-bike demo on scenic bluffs and along the Montreal River.

2022-01-07.name: Bald Eagle Days
2022-01-07.summary: At the Quad Cities Expo Center, there's an environmental fair, with flying demonstrations by eagles,  hawks and owls and hourlong eagle-watching tours.

2022-01-07.name: Breezy Point Ice Fest
2022-01-07.summary: This Brainerd Lakes resort village celebrates with horse-drawn sleigh rides, an ice slide, snow golf, bonfires and kids' ice fishing.

2022-01-07.name: Ice Festival
2022-01-07.summary: There are ice-climbing and winter camping clinics, a chili cook-off, door prizes and use of demo gear in Sandstone Ice Park.

2022-01-08.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-08.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-08.name: SISU Ski Fest
2022-01-08.summary: This Finnish fest includes a ski expo, free kids' ski, 5K Fun Ski, 15km and 30km ski races, a free after-party at the Historic Ironwood Theatre and a free fat-bike demo on scenic bluffs and along the Montreal River.

2022-01-08.name: Bald Eagle Days
2022-01-08.summary: At the Quad Cities Expo Center, there's an environmental fair, with flying demonstrations by eagles,  hawks and owls and hourlong eagle-watching tours.

2022-01-08.name: Breezy Point Ice Fest
2022-01-08.summary: This Brainerd Lakes resort village celebrates with horse-drawn sleigh rides, an ice slide, snow golf, bonfires and kids' ice fishing.

2022-01-08.name: Ice Festival
2022-01-08.summary: There are ice-climbing and winter camping clinics, a chili cook-off, door prizes and use of demo gear in Sandstone Ice Park.

2022-01-08.name: Winter Festival
2022-01-08.summary: Visit the Kickapoo Valley Reserve for horse-drawn bobsled rides, guided snowshoe and ice-cave hikes, winter games, fat-tire bike demos and a sled-dog race and weight pull.

2022-01-08.name: Gunflint Mail Run sled-dog race
2022-01-08.summary: In far northeast Minnesota, watch mushers travel two legs of 50 miles, starting and ending at the Trail Center Lodge on the Central Gunflint Trail.

2022-01-08.name: Bald Eagle Watch
2022-01-08.summary: Two Mississippi River towns host this event, with live-eagle and nature programs at Iowa's Clinton Community College  and free bus service to Lock & Dam 13 in Fulton, Ill.

2022-01-13.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-13.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-13.name: Icebox Days
2022-01-13.summary: In this far-north town, there will be smoosh races, frozen turkey bowling, a toilet-seat toss, boot hockey and fireworks. On Saturday, there's the annual Freeze Yer Gizzard Blizzard Run.

2022-01-13.name: World Championship Snowmobile Derby
2022-01-13.summary: Watch oval, snocross and vintage snowmobiles race in this northeast Wisconsin town, which attracts 40,000 spectators to the "Indianapolis 500 of snowmobile racing.''

2022-01-14.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-14.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-14.name: Janboree
2022-01-14.summary: The fest in this Milwaukee suburb includes Friday-night fireworks, ice  sculpting, Ojibwe snow-snake games, ice bocce, a penguin-egg hunt and tobogganing on the  lighted run in Lowell Park.

2022-01-14.name: Icebox Days
2022-01-14.summary: In this far-north town, there will be smoosh races, frozen turkey bowling, a toilet-seat toss, boot hockey and fireworks. On Saturday, there's the annual Freeze Yer Gizzard Blizzard Run.

2022-01-14.name: World Championship Snowmobile Derby
2022-01-14.summary: Watch oval, snocross and vintage snowmobiles race in this northeast Wisconsin town, which attracts 40,000 spectators to the "Indianapolis 500 of snowmobile racing.''

2022-01-14.name: Silver Mine Ski Jumping Championships
2022-01-14.summary: Watch top skiers from North America and Europe compete at Silver Mine Hill, above the Chippewa River on the southwest edge of town.

2022-01-14.name: Back to Hack Winter Festival
2022-01-14.summary: The festival in this Brainerd Lakes town on the Paul Bunyan State Trail features snow sculpting, ice golf, an ice-fishing contest, penguin plunge, kids' games and Saturday fireworks.

2022-01-15.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-15.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-15.name: Janboree
2022-01-15.summary: The fest in this Milwaukee suburb includes Friday-night fireworks, ice  sculpting, Ojibwe snow-snake games, ice bocce, a penguin-egg hunt and tobogganing on the  lighted run in Lowell Park.

2022-01-15.name: Art Shanty Projects
2022-01-15.summary: Frozen Lake Harriet hosts two dozen artist-designed ice houses and lots of fun art antics for kids and adults alike. Check for scheduled events and ice conditions.

2022-01-15.name: Icebox Days
2022-01-15.summary: In this far-north town, there will be smoosh races, frozen turkey bowling, a toilet-seat toss, boot hockey and fireworks. On Saturday, there's the annual Freeze Yer Gizzard Blizzard Run.

2022-01-15.name: World Championship Snowmobile Derby
2022-01-15.summary: Watch oval, snocross and vintage snowmobiles race in this northeast Wisconsin town, which attracts 40,000 spectators to the "Indianapolis 500 of snowmobile racing.''

2022-01-15.name: Silver Mine Ski Jumping Championships
2022-01-15.summary: Watch top skiers from North America and Europe compete at Silver Mine Hill, above the Chippewa River on the southwest edge of town.

2022-01-15.name: Back to Hack Winter Festival
2022-01-15.summary: The festival in this Brainerd Lakes town on the Paul Bunyan State Trail features snow sculpting, ice golf, an ice-fishing contest, penguin plunge, kids' games and Saturday fireworks.

2022-01-15.name: Bald Eagle Watching Days
2022-01-15.summary: This town along the Wisconsin River, next to a hydroelectric plant, offers guided bus tours, live birds of prey programs and kids' activities in addition to eagle viewing at overlooks staffed by volunteers.

2022-01-15.name: Bald Eagle Appreciation Days
2022-01-15.summary: There will be live-eagle presentations, Native American activities, seminars and viewing on the river in Keokuk on Saturday, and on Sunday activities will be in Montrose.

2022-01-15.name: Ice Fest
2022-01-15.summary: The National Mississippi River Museum hosts this indoor-outdoor festival, which includes ice-harvest and ice-rescue demonstrations, snow sculpting, a live-raptor program and youth ice fishing.

2022-01-15.name: Wisconsin Free Fishing Weekend
2022-01-15.summary: No license is needed for fishing in Wisconsin or on its side of the Mississippi River and lakes Superior and Michigan.

2022-01-15.name: Take a Kid Ice Fishing Weekend
2022-01-15.summary: Take a kid younger than 16 spear- or ice-fishing this holiday weekend, and you can fish for free.

2022-01-21.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-21.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-21.name: Janboree
2022-01-21.summary: The fest in this Milwaukee suburb includes Friday-night fireworks, ice  sculpting, Ojibwe snow-snake games, ice bocce, a penguin-egg hunt and tobogganing on the  lighted run in Lowell Park.

2022-01-21.name: World Snow Sculpting Championship
2022-01-21.summary: Snow-sculpting teams from around the world will compete in Lowell Park.

2022-01-21.name: Winterfest
2022-01-21.summary: In this town on the Mackinac Straits, there's a snow-sculpting competition, sleigh rides, a poker run and, on Saturday, outhouse races.

2022-01-21.name: Snowflake Ski-Jumping Tournament
2022-01-21.summary: At the top of a hill that's the equivalent of a 41-story skyscraper, watch jumpers fly by at 55 mph. It's fun to watch because the jump is built onto the side of a coulee, and spectators can climb it and watch from the top. There are hot drinks and food at the bottom.

2022-01-22.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-22.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-22.name: Art Shanty Projects
2022-01-22.summary: Frozen Lake Harriet hosts two dozen artist-designed ice houses and lots of fun art antics for kids and adults alike. Check for scheduled events and ice conditions.

2022-01-22.name: Snowflake Ski-Jumping Tournament
2022-01-22.summary: At the top of a hill that's the equivalent of a 41-story skyscraper, watch jumpers fly by at 55 mph. It's fun to watch because the jump is built onto the side of a coulee, and spectators can climb it and watch from the top. There are hot drinks and food at the bottom.

2022-01-22.name: Winterfest
2022-01-22.summary: Go on a beer and wine walk or compete in ham-throwing, log-sawing, wreath-tossing, the Amana Freezer Run/Walk or for the best beard. There will also be ice sculpting and chainsaw-carving.

2022-01-22.name: Beer & Cheese Fest
2022-01-22.summary: A celebration of Wisconsin's greatest products at Alliant Energy Center, with plenty to sample. Tickets sell out, so buy early.

2022-01-22.name: Lake Harriet Kite Festival
2022-01-22.summary: In addition to kite-flying, this event on popular Lake Harriet includes horse-drawn wagon rides, kids' ice fishing, arts, music and roasted marshmallows.

2022-01-28.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-28.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-28.name: Winter Carnival
2022-01-28.summary: This outdoor festival around Rice Park downtown features ice carving, parades, scavenger hunts, pop-up outdoor concerts, ice-fishing and softball and puzzle tournaments.

2022-01-28.name: Winter Games
2022-01-28.summary: This resort area in northwest Iowa will offer human sled races, flag football on ice, indoor golf, snowball drop, stein-holding, horse-drawn carriage rides, a Freeze Yer Fanny Bike Ride, keg toss and fireworks.

2022-01-28.name: Winterfest
2022-01-28.summary: In this Lake Michigan town, there's a human sled race, cardboard sled race, luau and snow-angel contest.

2022-01-28.name: Groundhog Days
2022-01-28.summary: The 1993 movie "Groundhog Day'' was filmed in this town an hour northwest of Chicago, and it celebrates with trivia, a bags tourney, bingo and walking tours of movie sites, including the 1889 Opera House, where actor Bill Murray jumped from the belfry. At 7 a.m. Wednesday, Woodstock Willie will look for his shadow.

2022-01-28.name: Lake Superior Ice Festival
2022-01-28.summary: On Barker's Island, there's a snow slide, ice carving, disc golf, ice racing, kids' activities and fireworks on Saturday.

2022-01-28.name: Heikki Lunta Winter Festival
2022-01-28.summary: This town just west of Marquette pays tribute to the Finnish snow god with a rail jam, snowshoe lantern tours, sliding, luging, a fat-tire race and fireworks.

2022-01-28.name: Fire & Ice Winter Social
2022-01-28.summary: In this St. Croix river town, there will be hot-air balloons, an ice-cream social, ice sculptures, music, bags and pond-hockey tournaments and a beer tent.

2022-01-29.name: Candlelight ski/snowshoe/hike
2022-01-29.summary: There's nothing better than skiing (or snowshoeing or hiking) through a twinkling forest or across a luminary-lined lake. There's usually a bonfire and hot chocolate to enjoy afterward.

2022-01-29.name: Fire & Ice Winter Social
2022-01-29.summary: In this St. Croix river town, there will be hot-air balloons, an ice-cream social, ice sculptures, music, bags and pond-hockey tournaments and a beer tent.

2022-01-29.name: International Festival
2022-01-29.summary: Dancers, musicians, storytellers and puppeteers representing traditions from around the world converge on the Overture Center for the Arts on State Street for this free festival.

2022-01-29.name: Art Sled Rally
2022-01-29.summary: Watch sledders or ride down a decorated hill at Powderhorn Park in your own wacky sled, which you can make at home or at free workshops at Powderhorn Park Community Center. There's also live music and hot chocolate.

2022-01-29.name: Norge Ski Jumping Tournament
2022-01-29.summary: See some of the nation's best jumpers compete in this northwest Chicago suburb, which has produced several Olympians.

2022-01-29.name: Winter Fest
2022-01-29.summary: On the 400 Block downtown, there will be ice carving, ice skating, games and, inside the Great Hall, art projects and free hot chocolate and cookies.

2022-01-29.name: Frostival
2022-01-29.summary: In this border town, events include snow-sculpture and disc-golf competitions, games, a snowshoe hike, marshmallow roast, snowga and free ski and snowshoe rentals.

2022-01-29.name: Duluth Ice & Mixed Fest
2022-01-29.summary: This annual festival in West Duluth's Quarry Park features such events as a free ice-climbing clinic for youths 12 and older, beginner and intermediate clinics for adult climbers, a fat-bike intro and presentations on mountain climbing.

2022-01-16.name: Janboree

2022-01-16.summary: Red Bull sponsors this street-snowboarding spectacle in hillside Cascade Park, at Mesaba Avenue and North First Street West on the north edge of downtown. Watching is free.
